prompts.value: Do you like to know if ingredients number in your product is halal or haraam?
Do you like to know if ingredients number in your product is halal or haraam?

speech: E-Numbers represent specific food additives, used by the food industry in the manufacture of various food products.

E-numbers are reference numbers used by the European Union to facilitate identification of food additives. Normally each food additive is assigned a unique number, though occasionally, related additives are given an extension ("a", "b", or "i", "ii") to another E-number.
Do you know: e100 to e199 represent "food colors"
Do you know: e300-e399 represent "antioxidants, phosphates, and complexing agents"
Do you know: e400-e499 represent "thickeners, gelling agents, phosphates, humectants, emulsifiers"
Do you know: e500-e599 represent "thickeners, gelling agents, phosphates, humectants, emulsifiers"
Do you know: e600-e699 represent "flavor enhancers"
Do you know: e700-e799 represent "not used for food additives (used for feed additives)"
Do you know: e900-e999 represent "surface coating agents, gases, sweeteners"
Do you know: e1000-e1399 represent "miscellaneous additive"
Do you know: e1400-e1499 represent "starch derivatives"

messages.speech: I can help you identify if product ingredients number is halal or not.
